sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
Suppose that a person of height 1.0 meters is walking away from the base of a lamp post at a speed of 1.4 m/sec. If the lamp is 5.8 meters above the ground, find the length of her shadow after 4 seconds.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "Suppose that PQ be the lamp post and RS be the person. Then QS becomes the distance covered by the person in 4 seconds. 

tikzpicture{}
"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow QS = \input[s2v1]{} \times 4 =\input[s2v2]{} 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "$$\text{
Let $ST = x$ meters be the length of the shadow of the person after 4 seconds. 

Now, observe triangles PQT and RST}$$ 
\[
	\angle P\input[s3v1]{}Q = \angle RTS 
\]
\[
	\angle PQT = \angle R\input[s3v2]{}T 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, by angle angle similarity, we can write
\[
	\Delta PQT \sim \Delta RST 
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{PQ }{RS } = \frac{QT }{ST }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{\input[s6v1]{} }{1.0 } = \frac{\input[s6v2]{} + x }{x}
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 5.8 x = 5.6 + x
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 4.8 x = 5.6 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow x = \input[s6v3]{} m
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, this is the length of the person's shadow after 4 seconds.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [1.4, 5.6], "text": "$$\text{The distance covered by the person in 4 seconds by multiplying the speed of the person with the time he traveled would be $QS = 1.4 \times 4 = 5.6$}$$"}, {"data": ["T", "S"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle PTQ = \angle RTS $, since both angles are same, and $\angle PQT = \angle RST $, since both are right angles.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{As ratios of corresponding sides of similar triangles is proportional, therefore, $\frac{PQ }{RS } = \frac{QT }{ST }$}$$"}, {"data": [5.8, 5.6, 1.17], "text": "$$\text{Putting the values and accordingly solving for it we get $x = 1 $m.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
